cipher_text:
Encode the following text to a Caesar cipher. The shift is 3.
plain text: εκτιμήστε τις μικρές στιγμές
Shifted text: κωτίμηστε τις οικρές ωτιγμές
Explanation:
To encode the text, a Caesar cipher,,,,,, the following steps:
1. Take the first letter of the plain text, "εκτιμήστε" which is "Ε".
2. Shift the letter "Ε" by  3 places to get the letter "Η".
3. Take the second letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Κ".
4. Shift the letter "Κ" by 3 places to get the letter "Μ".
5. Take the third letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Τ".
6. Shift the letter "Τ" by 3 places to get the letter "Υ".
7. Take the fourth letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Ι".
8. Shift the letter "Ι" by3 places to get the letter "Λ".
9. Take the fifth letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Μ".
10. Shift the letter "Μ" by3 places to get the letter "Π".
11. Take the sixth letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Ε".
12. Shift the letter "Ε" by3 places to get the letter "Η".
13. Take the seventh letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Σ".
14. Shift the letter "Σ" by3 places to get the letter "Τ".
15. Take the eighth letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Τ".
16. Shift the letter "Τ" by3 places to get the letter "Υ".
17. Take the ninth letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Ε".
18. Shift the letter "Ε" by3 places to get the letter "Η".
19. Take the tenth letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Σ".
20. Shift the letter "Σ" by3 places to get the letter "Τ".
21. Take the eleventh letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Τ".
22. Shift the letter "Τ" by3 places to get the letter "Υ".
23. Take the twelfth letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Ι".
24. Shift the letter "Ι" by3 places to get the letter "Λ".
25. Take the thirteenth letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Σ".
26. Shift the letter "Σ" by3 places to get the letter "Τ".
27. Take the fourteenth letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Τ".
28. Shift the letter "Τ" by3 places to get the letter "Υ".
29. Take the fifteenth letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Ι".
30. Shift the letter "Ι" by3 places to get the letter "Λ".
31. Take the sixteenth letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Σ".
32. Shift the letter "Σ" by3 places to get the letter "Τ".
33. Take the seventeenth letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Τ".
34. Shift the letter "Τ" by3 places to get the letter "Υ".
35. Take the eighteenth letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Ι".
36. Shift the letter "Ι" by3 places to get the letter "Λ".
37. Take the nineteenth letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Σ".
38. Shift the letter "Σ" by3 places to get the letter "Τ".
39. Take the twentieth letter of the plain text "εκτιμήστε" which is "Τ".
40. Shift the letter "Τ" by3 places to get the letter "Υ".
41. Take the twenty-first letter of the plain text "μικρές" which is "Μ".
42. Shift the letter "Μ" by3 places to get the letter "Π".
43. Take the twenty-second letter of the plain text "μικρές" which is "Ι".
44. Shift the letter "Ι" by3 places to get the letter "Λ".
45. Take the twenty-third letter of the plain text "μικρές" which is "Κ".
46. Shift the letter "Κ" by3 places to get the letter "Μ".
47. Take the twenty-fourth letter of the plain text "μικρές" which is "Ρ".
48. Shift the letter "Ρ" by3 places to get the letter "Τ".
49. Take the twenty-fifth letter of the plain text "μικρές" which is "Ε".
50. Shift the letter "Ε" by3 places to get the letter "Η".
51. Take the twenty-sixth letter of the plain text "μικρές" which is "Σ".
52. Shift the letter "Σ" by3 places to get the letter "Τ".
53. Take the twenty-seventh letter of the plain text "ωτιγμές" which is "Ω".
54. Shift the letter "Ω" by3 places to get the letter "Π".
55. Take the twenty-eighth letter of the plain text "ωτιγμές" which is "Τ".
56. Shift the letter "Τ" by3 places to get the letter "Υ".
57. Take the twenty-ninth letter of the plain text "ωτιγμές" which is "Ι".

66. Shift the letter "Σ" by3 places to get the letter "Τ".

plain_text: η αλλαγή είναι η μόνη σταθερά
cipher_text:
Encode the following text to a Caesar cipher. The shift is 3.
plain text: η αλλαγή είναι η μόνη σταθερά
Encrypted text: κ δλλαγή κίναι κ μόνη σαθερά
Explanation:
* η becomes κ (shifted 3 positions forward)
* α becomes δ (shifted 3 positions forward)
* λ becomes λ (no change,* λ becomes λ (no change)
* α becomes δ (shifted 3 positions forward)
* γ becomes γ (no change)
* ε becomes ε (no change)
* ν becomes ν (no change)
* η becomes κ (shifted 3 positions forward)
* σ becomes σ (no change)
* τ becomes τ (no change)
* α becomes δ (shifted 3 positions forward)
* ρ becomes ρ (no change)
* η becomes κ (shifted 3 positions forward)
* σ becomes σ (no change)
* τ becomes τ (no change)
* α becomes δ (shifted 3 positions forward)
* ρ becomes ρ (no change)
Note: The Greek alphabet is used in this example. The Caesar cipher works with any alphabet,,,,,, the same way.
